references.reason: This paper is foundational for the concept of autotelic problem generation, which is central to the current paper's methodology.
This paper provides a theoretical framework for goal-directed exploration, which is used to guide the generation of diverse and challenging puzzles.

references.paper_title: Quality Diversity: A New Frontier for Evolutionary Computation
references.reason: This paper introduces the Quality Diversity algorithm, which is adapted and extended in this paper to generate diverse programming puzzles.

references.paper_title: Autotelic Agents with Intrinsically Motivated Goal-Conditioned Reinforcement Learning: a Short Survey
references.reason: This survey paper provides a comprehensive overview of autotelic learning methods and their applications in various fields, informing the design and evaluation of the ACES algorithm.
This paper introduces the Python Programming Puzzles dataset (P3), which is used as a benchmark for evaluating the quality and difficulty of generated puzzles.
